rev.comment: actually, the claim is not that he was the first emoticon user; just that he came up with the "smiley emoticons"

Some dispute the claim that he was the first emoticon user, since a similar marker appeared in an article of Reader's Digest in May of 1967. [http://www.snopes.com/computer/internet/smiley.asp]
+
Though credited with originating the smiley emoticons, he was not the first emoticon user; a similar marker appeared in an article of [[Reader's Digest]] in May of 1967.[http://www.snopes.com/computer/internet/smiley.asp]
Fahlman received his [[bachelor's degree]] and [[master's degree]] in [[1973]] from [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology|MIT]], and his [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] from [[MIT]] in [[1977]]. His thesis advisors were Drs [[Gerald Sussman]] and [[Marvin Minsky]]. He is a fellow of the [[American Association for Artificial Intelligence]].
Fahlman received his [[bachelor's degree]] and [[master's degree]] in [[1973]] from [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology|MIT]], and his [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] from [[MIT]] in [[1977]]. His thesis advisors were Drs [[Gerald Sussman]] and [[Marvin Minsky]]. He is a fellow of the [[American Association for Artificial Intelligence]].
